resources.string:
Multiplication

Example : 43 x 78

Step 1 : Finding the Units Digit

The first objective would be to get the units digit. In order to do this we just need to multiply the units digit of both the numbers. thus, 3 x 8 would give us 24. Hence, we would write 4 in the units digit of the answer and carry over the digit 2 to the tens place as follows

43

x 78

_______

4
